design_audit.treatment_timing: Cotton Famine onset 1861 (post = period 1861-1865 vs pre = 1851-1855)
design_audit.treatment_definition: cotton_dist x post: binary indicator for cotton-dependent registration district interacted with post-famine period
design_audit.comparison_groups: Non-cotton districts serve as controls; nearby districts (0-25km, 25-50km, 50-75km) included as separate treatment intensities

claim_object.outcome_concept: Standardized total mortality rate (census_mr_tot): linked deaths per 1000 persons per year, scaled by age-reweighting lambda
claim_object.treatment_concept: Exposure to the Lancashire Cotton Famine (cotton district x post-1861 interaction)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ATT: effect of cotton famine exposure on mortality in cotton-dependent districts relative to non-cotton districts
claim_object.target_population: Registration districts in England and Wales with linkable death records, 1851-1865

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col1
baseline_specs.description: Baseline DD: census_mr_tot ~ cotton_dist_post | master_name + period, aweight=pop_census_tot, cluster(master_name)

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col2
baseline_specs.description: Add density, pop shares, region x period FE
baseline_specs.notes: _IregXpost_* expands to multiple region x post interactions via xi i.region*post

constraints.notes: Controls build up incrementally across Table 2 columns: Col 1 has none, Col 2 adds demographics + density + region x period FE, Col 3 adds nearby district spillover rings. Col 4 (continuous treatment) moved to explore/* because it changes the treatment variable. Region x period FE (_IregXpost_*) count as a single conceptual block. Note: population weights (aweight=pop_census_tot) and mortality rate denominator are mechanically linked -- the same pop variable enters both.

explore_universe.description: Table 2 Col 4: uses continuous cotton employment share (cotton_eshr_post) instead of binary cotton district indicator. Changes the treatment concept from binary to dose-response.

canonical.notes: Paper's baseline clusters at district (master_name) level.

variants.notes: County-level clustering (Table 2 county panel). Coarser than district.
Robust SEs without clustering (used in permutation exercise).
Permutation test: reassigns treatment to each district based on spatial distance structure. P-values reported in T2_Pvalues.csv.

sampling.notes: Control set is small (5 conceptual blocks). LOO over blocks is feasible. Data construction variants (linking restrictions) add 6 specs. Sample exclusion variants add 2. Weights variant adds 1. Total well within budget.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Figure 4: Population trends in cotton vs non-cotton vs nearby districts across census years.
Table 12 (AppendixD3): Placebo test using 1856-1860 vs 1851-1855 with BMD data.

claim_object.treatment_concept: Exposure to the Lancashire Cotton Famine
claim_object.estimand_concept: ATT: age-decomposed effect of cotton famine on mortality by age group
claim_object.target_population: Registration districts in England and Wales, 1851-1865, by age group

baseline_specs.label: Table3-AgeGroups
baseline_specs.description: Seven age-group DD regressions (under15, 15-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-54, 55-64, over64) with full controls, nearby ring indicators, region x period FE, population weights by age group, cluster(master_name)
baseline_specs.notes: Each age group is a separate regression with age-group-specific controls (linkable share, pop density). 7 parallel regressions.

constraints.notes: Table 3 uses the preferred specification (matching Table 2 Col 3) for each age group. Control set is fixed.

variants.notes: Permutation test for age-specific results (Table 3 p-values).

sampling.notes: 7 age groups x (1 baseline + 2 RC) = 21 core specs. Within budget.
